content: Welcome to the Cologne connectathon! This thread will be home for discussion on the Care Planning and Care Management track, http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201805_Care_Plan

Care Planning and Management track will have a breakout at 1:00 in Salon 14 where we will review and demonstrate results from the weekend integrating care planning with clinical reasoning and CDS Hooks.

We have reserved breakout rooms today and tomorrow to gather in a private space. Please notify other interested parties. Still looking for a link to maps of the building to find these rooms.

Saturday 10-11am in Chesapeak A Room (20 people)
Sunday 11-12am in Constellation F (20 people)
10:00 breakout today, Chesapeak A is on 3rd floor. Get off the elevator and go left (perhaps depending on the elevator...)

Please find below the FHIR server end point for Plan Definitions. Based on Betsy Johnson's case, we have included three plan definitions in the server. If anyone needs more content for any other specific cases, please feel free to contact us.

Diabetes Mellitus Type 2 - Ambulatory: http://elsevier.demo.elsevierfhir.com/fhir/PlanDefinition/45991
Heart Failure - Ambulatory: http://elsevier.demo.elsevierfhir.com/fhir/PlanDefinition/47741
Chronic Kidney Disease - Ambulatory: http://elsevier.demo.elsevierfhir.com/fhir/PlanDefinition/52778

Feedbacks are very much appreciated ...

Thanks & Regards,

Sunish - s.vengathattil@elsevier.com
Garett - g.miller@elsevier.com
Radmila - r.bord@elsevier.com

Perspecta FHIR URL (no OAuth)
https://fhir-dev1.openplatform.healthcare
Break the glass - add an HTTP Header called "Category" and make the content http://hl7.org/fhir/security-label#break-the-glass; scheme="http://hl7.org/fhir/tag/security"; label="Break The Glass"
@Sean Muir Specialist Auth Header: 8,SPEC,TREAT
We have meeting in break out room Constellation F starting in 5 minutes at 11:00, all interested folks are welcome!
We will have a final review and demo of track accomplishments in Columbia Room from 3:30 - 4:30 this afternoon.
Remaining task list for today:

Jeff: send updated Care Plan to HC
- Carlos/Tim: view Care Plan and MedicationRequest in HC Viewer
- Jason/Ram: send patient entered data (observations) back to HC
- Irina/Peter: ingest R4 Care Plan for LTSS into HC
- Sean: Complete specialist App

o Pull data from HC
o Order opioid
o Drug check with Motive
o Break the glass
o New order and drug check
o Send data (including specialized care plan if possible) to HC
- Julie/Matt: finalize drug check logic
- Dave/Tim: Connect Dave’s mobile app to HC
- Kathleen/Mark: work out ROA with MiHIN
- Man: pull data form MiHIN into HC – need credentials
- Bo: Create demo script
Is this being recorded?
Can you post the steps in the zulip chat?
report out video recording https://youtu.be/1Fk6sagQRXg
Sample data JSON files for our patient persona, Betsy Johnson, are available here: https://github.com/chronic-care/sample-data
I created a new HSPC sandbox instance (v3.0.1) loaded with these sample data, with an open endpoint:
https://api-v5-stu3.hspconsortium.org/careplanning20/open

Care Planning track (and all interested individuals) will meet in a breakout room from 11:00-12:30 today in the FRIO Room (Capacity 25). Terrific opportunity for cross-track collaboration, please join us!

The sample data seems to contain reference to the StructureDefinition for R4 - the current published version. But I understand that this sample data is intended to only be based on STU3. For instance, the "meta.profile" elements in cc-betsy-8-teams.json is specified as "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/CareTeam". Do these need to be updated?
Hmm, thanks Chris. Interesting question, is there a canonical URI for structure definitions that is not specific to FHIR version?
Per the R4 specification, it looks like the meta.profile element needs to be "http://hl7.org/fhir/3.0/StructureDefinition/Patient" to explicitly reference STU3.
BTW, this is as per http://hl7.org/fhir/versioning.html#mp-version

Care Planning track will meet in a breakout room this afternoon, 2:00 – 3:00 Live Oak Room (Capactiy 45). All interested individuals are welcome to join us for a debrief on our successful weekend! PlanDefinition standards for clinical practice guidelines, used to create new CarePlans, shared via an integration server with the care team.

Care Planning track will meet in breakout room Salon 1 (second floor) from 10:00 - 11:00 today. This track integrates topics of interest to many other tracks and all connectathon participants are welcome to attend and learn/contribute. Our wiki page is https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2019-05+Care+Planning+Track

Care Planning topics this weekend include review and testing of the draft HL7 CPG-on-FHIR IG -- Clinical Practice Guidelines on FHIR, plus relationship with IHE profile for dynamic care plans. These IGs document patterns for using PlanDefinition, ActivityDefinition and CQL for practice guidelines, and using those definitions to create care plans and manage care for chronic conditions.

Overview of IHE Dynamic Care Planning (DCP) Profile - describes the FHIR constructs used in this track - https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Dynamic_Care_Planning
The Profile is here - http://ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/PCC/IHE_PCC_Suppl_DCP.pdf
Most recent update to the DCP Profile is to dynamically include creation and update of care teams/care team members while care planning.

Current very early draft for HL7 CPG-on-FHIR IG is here: http://build.fhir.org/ig/cqframework/cdc-acg/index.html, and will be migrated to an HL7 FHIR IG template and GitHub site soon, expected this week (thanks, @Bryn Rhodes )

Elsevier updated their FHIR endpoint to R4, allowing query of clinical practice guidelines from their knowledge base exported as FHIR PlanDefinition and ActivityDefinition resources. For example, this query uses SNOMED code for Chronic Kidney Disease to retrieve CKD plan definition: http://himss19.elsevierfhir.com/fhir/r4/PlanDefinition?context-type=709044004
(Note, this search should be changed to 'context' instead of 'context-type')

Using the sample dataset for this connectathon track loaded into an HSPC server, you can execute the same query as: https://api-v8-r4.hspconsortium.org/CarePlanningR4/open/PlanDefinition?context=709044004
These sample data will be aligned with those from Elsevier (and others) and included as part of the CPG-on-FHIR IG. Sample data sources are here: https://github.com/chronic-care/sample-data

Care Planning track will meet in breakout room Salon 5 at 2:00 today (15 minutes from now). Will review accomplishments from this weekend and plan priorities for September connectathon to include use of CQL with plan definitions.

Care Planning track will meet this morning in breakout room M104 from 10:00 - 11:00 am. This track focuses on an integrative use case planning and managing care for patients with multiple chronic conditions, all connectathon participants are welcome to attend and learn/contribute.

Topics this weekend include testing the HL7 CPG-on-FHIR IG -- Clinical Practice Guidelines on FHIR -- that documents patterns for using PlanDefinition, ActivityDefinition and CQL for practice guidelines, and using those definitions to create care plans and manage care for chronic conditions.
Care Planning track will meet in breakout room M104 from 10:00 - 11:00 am.

Visit us at Table 10 for the Payer Coverage Decision Exchange at #DaVinci to test FHIR CarePlan exchanges bundled with Coverage data, Prior Auth data, guidelines and attachments using patient-driven OAuth and CommunicationRequests!

To follow up on this morning's (9/14/2014) breakout session - I'm Andy Donnell from Elsevier. I'd love to chat further with anyone regarding how to map nursing plans of care with the FHIR spec. I'll be situated somewhere amongst the Care Planning and Management tables throughout the weekend.

@Dave Carlson Here are the coordinates for the IBM FHIR server endpoint:

curl -i -u 'apikey:wpUn-gVRKvedsOJApXcJyggGkRoUEdcfqrRIsOLSgEK6' 'https://cthon22.wh-fhir.dev.cloud.ibm.com/wh-fhir-dev/api/v4/metadata'

Revised Elsevier FHIR endpoints (in addition to the CKD search-by-SNOMED on the Confluence page:
Diabetes Mellitus Type 2 - Ambulatory: http://fhir.dev.elsevierfhir.com/fhir/r4/PlanDefinition/65239
Chronic Kidney Disease - Ambulatory: http://fhir.dev.elsevierfhir.com/fhir/r4/PlanDefinition/65237
Is anyone else working specifically around nursing documents?
Care Planning track, please add your name to the attendance list at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Attendance+Page

This might be a little late, but if anyone is interested in testing out the NutritionOrder resource (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/nutritionorder.html) or the new NutritionIntake resource (http://build.fhir.org/nutritionintake.html) I'd love to hear your feedback on it. I'm available to provide guidance on them.
Care Planning breakout NOW in room M101
